definition: the Xirong, an ancient ethnic group of Western China from the Zhou Dynasty onwards/Xionites (Central Asian nomads)
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish
west
generic term for weapons (old)/army (matters)/military affairs

the state of Qin, one of the seven states of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
Eastern barbarian/ancient ethnic group of northeast frontier of China
ancient people of central Asia during the Han dynasty
Xiongnu, a people of the Eastern Steppe who created an empire that flourished around the time of the Qin and Han dynasties
the state of Chu, one of the most important of the small states contending for power in China between 770 and 223 BC, located around present-day Hubei

the Zhou dynasty from 1027 BC
Duke Mu of Qin, the first substantial king of Qin (ruled 659-621 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
Xianbei or Xianbi, group of northern nomadic peoples

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
Zhao, one of the seven states during the Warring States Period of Chinese history (475-220 BC)
